title: What is the contribution of anthropology to education? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cultural anthropology aids us in understanding the social and physical adaptations that humans make in varying environments. This cross-cultural knowledge helps other cultures makes similar adaptations to make their lives more functional. Physical anthropology helps us understand how our bodies change over time to improve our functionality. Opposable thumbs, which are absent in other primates, allow us to be better users of tools which help us improve our adaptation to our environment. Social anthropology looks within cultural groups. It determines the type of interaction between members of the same group. Things like kinship, pair bonding practices, governmental structures, leadership, and problem solving are all studied and this leads us to understand better ways to function within a society.

Anthropology - the study of mankind - includes the cross cultural studies of human societies through time. It includes culural anthropology, social anthropology, archaeology, linguistics, and physical anthropology which covers human evolution and can include the study of other primates. Its contribution to education? Anthropology is an educational discipline. As for specific contributions to education, that has never been its subject matter.
